alwaysTransmit.name: alwaysTransmit
alwaysTransmit.tip: Always transmit channel output data even when no sequence or effect is playing.  Some controllers may need constant data coming in to prevent them from going into a built in test mode.

AudioFormat.name: AudioFormat
AudioFormat.tip: The Audio Format generated by the decoder can be changed to work with certain audio devices that can not work with multiple formats.  Leaving this setting at 'Default' is recommended unless you are experiencing issues

AudioMixerDevice.name: AudioMixerDevice
AudioMixerDevice.tip: The Audio Mixer Device specifies the mixer device which should be used by FPP to control the volume of audio playback.

AudioOutput.name: AudioOutput
AudioOutput.tip: The Audio Output Device determines which audio device is used for audio playback.  This may be an onboard analog audio device, the HDMI output on a Raspberry Pi, or a USB sound card.

backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor
backgroundColor.tip: The header background color of the FPP User Interface can be changed to make it easier to distinguish visually between multiple installed FPP instances.

BBBLedPWR.name: BBBLedPWR
BBBLedPWR.tip: Controls whether the power indicator LED on the BeagleBone is enabled or disabled

BBBLeds0.name: BBBLeds0
BBBLeds0.tip: Controls the function of the USR0 LED indicator on the BeagleBone

BBBLeds1.name: BBBLeds1
BBBLeds1.tip: Controls the function of the USR1 LED indicator on the BeagleBone

BBBLeds2.name: BBBLeds2
BBBLeds2.tip: Controls the function of the USR2 LED indicator on the BeagleBone

BBBLeds3.name: BBBLeds3
BBBLeds3.tip: Controls the function of the USR3 LED indicator on the BeagleBone

blankBetweenSequences.name: blankBetweenSequences
blankBetweenSequences.tip: Blank Between Sequences instructs FPP to send blanking data out all channel outputs between each sequence played in a playlist.  This can be used to turn off all the lights after each sequence if the sequences do not end with all channels turned off.

bridgeDataPriority.name: bridgeDataPriority
bridgeDataPriority.tip: Describes how to handle if bridge data (E131 or DDP) is received while a sequence is playing.

bootDelay.name: bootDelay
bootDelay.tip: The time that FPP waits after system boot up to start fppd.  For environments that are powered down regularly, fppd may start up quicker than the network environment fully starts up which may cause E1.31 multicast to not work properly.  Setting a Boot Delay will cause fppd to wait 'X' number of seconds to start which can give the network switches and routers time to fully start up.

ClockDate.name: ClockDate
ClockDate.tip: Current Date to use to set the system date.

ClockTime.name: ClockTime
ClockTime.tip: Current Time to use to set the system time.  Time must be in 24-hour format.

CompressMultiSyncTransfers.name: CompressMultiSyncTransfers
CompressMultiSyncTransfers.description: Compress files during copy to Remotes to speed up file sync process
CompressMultiSyncTransfers.tip: Compress files during copy to speed up the sync process.  NOTE: Newer xLights versions already used a compressed FSEQ format, so this option may only slow down the transfer as FPP tries to recompress already-compressed data.

DisableFakeNetworkBridges.name: DisableFakeNetworkBridges
DisableFakeNetworkBridges.tip: FPP normally listens on the network bridge ports for incoming data even when not running in Bridge mode to monitor for and identify misconfigurations in the environment.  The disable setting is provided to allow the user to disable these listeners if they need to spin up their own listener software.

disableIPAnnouncement.name: disableIPAnnouncement
disableIPAnnouncement.tip: During boot, the current IP addresses will be announced over the audio output.  This setting allows disabling this announcement for production use when FPP is connected to a FM transmitter or speakers.

disableUIWarnings.name: disableUIWarnings
disableUIWarnings.tip: Disable the 'restart required' and 'reboot required' warnings that appear at the top of the page when settings are changed.

DisableScheduler.name: DisableScheduler
DisableScheduler.tip: The Disable Scheduler setting allows disabling all scheduling rather than having to go to each schedule entry and deactivate.

E131BridgingInterval.name: E131BridgingInterval
E131BridgingInterval.tip: The default Transmit Interval in E1.31 Bridge Mode is 50ms.  This setting allows changing this to match the rate the player is outputting. WARNING - Some output devices such as the FPD do not support rates other than 50ms.

emailfromtext.name: emailfromtext
emailfromtext.tip: Text to use in From field of emails.

emailfromuser.name: emailfromuser
emailfromuser.tip: Email address to be used to send emails.

emailpass.name: emailpass
emailpass.tip: Password to be used to authenticate with email server.

emailport.name: emailport
emailport.tip: TCP Port used on SMTP server.  Most server use 587 for encrypted traffic, some servers may still use 25 for non-encrypted SMTP traffic.

emailserver.name: emailserver
emailserver.tip: Server used to send outbound email.

emailtoemail.name: emailtoemail
emailtoemail.tip: Default destination email address to send all emails.

emailuser.name: emailuser
emailuser.tip: Login for SMTP server, may be the same as the from address.

EnableTethering.name: EnableTethering
EnableTethering.tip: Enable or disable FPP WiFi tethering mode

FPP_UUID.name: FPP_UUID
FPP_UUID.description: UUID to use for stats collection
FPP_UUID.tip: FPP UUID to use for stats collection.  This will override using the serial number from /proc/cpuinfo or dmidecode.

fppMode.name: fppMode
fppMode.tip: FPP can run either as a Player where it can schedule and run various playlists, sequences, etc... or in Remote mode where another FPP instance will be in control of scheduling.

FetchVendorLogos.name: FetchVendorLogos
FetchVendorLogos.tip: Some capes/hats fetch the vendor logo from their website when using the FPP UI.  This discloses your IP address to the vendor.

ForceHDMI.name: ForceHDMI
ForceHDMI.tip: Force the Raspberry Pi to use the HDMI output as the default display.  This is sometimes required if the HDMI display is not detected properly or is not powered when the Pi is booted.  Turning this setting on will prevent using the Composite output on the Pi until the setting is disabled.

ForceHDMIResolution.name: ForceHDMIResolution
ForceHDMIResolution.tip: Force the Raspberry Pi to set the HDMI output to the give resolution.  The default is whatever settings the monitor reports at bootup time.

ForceHDMIResolutionPort2.name: ForceHDMIResolutionPort2
ForceHDMIResolutionPort2.tip: Force the Raspberry Pi 4's second HDMI to the give resolution.  The default is whatever settings the monitor reports at bootup time.

gitBranch.name: gitBranch
gitBranch.tip: Switch code branches to test features outside the current release branch.  The 'master' branch is the main development branch for the next version of FPP.  There may also be a 'master-vY.x' branch were 'Y' is the major FPP version.  These master-v* branches are created to allow development on the next major release to continue in the master branch while bugfixes for the 'Y' release are applied only to the master-vY.x branch.

HostName.name: HostName
HostName.tip: Host names must contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens and must begin with a letter or a number
HostName.regexDesc: Host names must contain only letters, numbers and hyphens

Latitude.name: Latitude
Latitude.tip: Latitude of geographic location of FPP system.  The latitude/longitude can be used by the FPP scheduler to calculate the sunrise/sunset times.  The default values provided are for Falcon, Colorado.

LEDDisplayType.name: LEDDisplayType
LEDDisplayType.tip: Status Display type.  There are several OLED/LCD displays which can be attached to the i2c bus on the Pi and BeagleBone.  This setting is used to configure the size and type of display installed.

Locale.name: Locale
Locale.tip: The Locale is used to automatically configure some locale or region-specific functionality within FPP such as the list of Holidays included in the FPP Scheduler.

LogLevel_General.name: LogLevel_General
LogLevel_General.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for General Functions.

LogLevel_ChannelOut.name: LogLevel_ChannelOut
LogLevel_ChannelOut.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Channel Testing and Overlays.

LogLevel_ChannelData.name: LogLevel_ChannelData
LogLevel_ChannelData.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Serial and LOR output.

LogLevel_Command.name: LogLevel_Command
LogLevel_Command.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Commands.

LogLevel_E131Bridge.name: LogLevel_E131Bridge
LogLevel_E131Bridge.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for E131 and DDP input Bridge.

LogLevel_Effect.name: LogLevel_Effect
LogLevel_Effect.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Effects.

LogLevel_MediaOut.name: LogLevel_MediaOut
LogLevel_MediaOut.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Audio and Video Output.

LogLevel_Playlist.name: LogLevel_Playlist
LogLevel_Playlist.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Playlists.

LogLevel_Schedule.name: LogLevel_Schedule
LogLevel_Schedule.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for the Scheduler.

LogLevel_Sequence.name: LogLevel_Sequence
LogLevel_Sequence.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Sequence Parsing.

LogLevel_Settings.name: LogLevel_Settings
LogLevel_Settings.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs when parsing Settings.

LogLevel_Control.name: LogLevel_Control
LogLevel_Control.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for MQTT input

LogLevel_Sync.name: LogLevel_Sync
LogLevel_Sync.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for MultiSync.

LogLevel_Plugin.name: LogLevel_Plugin
LogLevel_Plugin.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for Plugin Management.

LogLevel_GPIO.name: LogLevel_GPIO
LogLevel_GPIO.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for GPIO Input/Output.

LogLevel_HTTP.name: LogLevel_HTTP
LogLevel_HTTP.tip: The Log Level controls the detail amount included in the FPP logs for fppd Rest API.

Longitude.name: Longitude
Longitude.tip: Longitude of geographic location of FPP system.  The latitude/longitude can be used by the FPP scheduler to calculate the sunrise/sunset times.  The default values provided are for Falcon, Colorado.

masqUIPlatform.name: masqUIPlatform
masqUIPlatform.tip: UI Masquerade allows a developer to have a system masquerade as another platform to help test different UI configurations.  This may not work in all situations where the actual platform is required such as if the detection of certain hardware is required to configure the UI.

mediaOffset.name: mediaOffset
mediaOffset.tip: The Media Offset value allows adjusting the synchronization of the media and sequences being played.  The value is specified in milliseconds.  A positive value moves the media ahead, a negative value moves the media back.  Changing this value requires a FPPD restart.  WARNING - This offset applies to all media files played.  If your media files require different offsets per file then you will have to edit the audio files or sequences to bring them into sync.

MQTTCaFile.name: MQTTCaFile
MQTTCaFile.tip: Optional CA File to authenticate the MQTT broker's certificate.  Only required when using SSL encryption and self-signed certificates.

MQTTFrequency.name: MQTTFrequency
MQTTFrequency.tip: Optional frequency to publish FPP status to MQTT Broker.  Zero indicates that the status will only be published on demand.

MQTTClientId.name: MQTTClientId
MQTTClientId.tip: If not set, one will be generated

MQTTHost.name: MQTTHost
MQTTHost.tip: Hostname or IP of your MQTT broker

MQTTPassword.name: MQTTPassword
MQTTPassword.tip: Password to use to authenticate with the MQTT broker

MQTTPort.name: MQTTPort
MQTTPort.tip: TCP Port number on which your MQTT broker is listening

MQTTPrefix.name: MQTTPrefix
MQTTPrefix.tip: Topic prefix to use when sending messages to the MQTT broker

MQTTSubscribe.name: MQTTSubscribe
MQTTSubscribe.tip: Subscribe to a MQTT topic.  Use '#' (without the quotes) to subscribe to all topics from MQTT server.  Use 'smartthings/#' to subscribe to all topics starting with 'smartthings', or use an exact topic to subscribe to a single topic.

MQTTUsername.name: MQTTUsername
MQTTUsername.tip: Username to use to authenticate with the MQTT broker

MultiSyncEnabled.name: MultiSyncEnabled
MultiSyncEnabled.tip: When enabled, FPP will send packets to FPP remotes to keep them in sync.

MultiSyncExternalIPAddress.name: MultiSyncExternalIPAddress
MultiSyncExternalIPAddress.description: External IP Address For Multisync Packets
MultiSyncExternalIPAddress.tip: The External IP address that other hosts see for this FPP instance.  Leave blank for default.

MultiSyncAdvancedView.name: MultiSyncAdvancedView
MultiSyncAdvancedView.tip: Show additional information about each FPP system.

MultiSyncBroadcast.name: MultiSyncBroadcast
MultiSyncBroadcast.description: Send MultiSync to ALL remotes via Broadcast
MultiSyncBroadcast.tip: Use a network broadcast to send MultiSync messages to all remotes.

MultiSyncCopyEffects.name: MultiSyncCopyEffects
MultiSyncCopyEffects.tip: Copy Effects from this FPP instance to Remote.

MultiSyncCopyEvents.name: MultiSyncCopyEvents
MultiSyncCopyEvents.tip: Copy Events from this FPP instance to Remote.

MultiSyncCopyScripts.name: MultiSyncCopyScripts
MultiSyncCopyScripts.tip: Copy Scripts from this FPP instance to Remote.

MultiSyncCopySequences.name: MultiSyncCopySequences
MultiSyncCopySequences.tip: Copy FSEQ sequence files from this FPP instance to Remotes.  WARNING: Newer xLights versions create host-specific .fseq files which only contain the channels for each individual FPP instance.  If you are using these newer files, the .fseq on the FPP player may not contain all the channel data needed to properly play on each FPP Remote instance

MultiSyncCopyVideos.name: MultiSyncCopyVideos
MultiSyncCopyVideos.tip: Copy Videos from this FPP instance to Remote.

MultiSyncCopyMusic.name: MultiSyncCopyMusic
MultiSyncCopyMusic.tip: Copy Music from this FPP instance to Remote.

MultiSyncExtraRemotes.name: MultiSyncExtraRemotes
MultiSyncExtraRemotes.tip: FPP will send unicast MultiSync discovery messages to the IPs in this list to allow discovery of devices which are unable to be discovered via FPP's normal multicast discovery.  This may include systems on remote networks or connected to certain routers which do not pass multicast packets between wired and wireless interfaces.

MultiSyncHide10.name: MultiSyncHide10
MultiSyncHide10.tip: Hide subnets in private 10.0.0.0/8 IP space.

MultiSyncHide172.name: MultiSyncHide172
MultiSyncHide172.tip: Hide subnets in private 172.16.0.0/12 IP space.

MultiSyncHide192.name: MultiSyncHide192
MultiSyncHide192.tip: Hide subnets in private 192.168.0.0/16 IP space.

MultiSyncHTTPSubnets.name: MultiSyncHTTPSubnets
MultiSyncHTTPSubnets.tip: List of comma separated subnets or IPs to scan looking for network attached pixel controllers.  Individual IPs may be listed as either A.B.C.D/32 or just A.B.C.D.  Subnets are listed as A.B.C.D/X.  FPP will attempt to discover these controllers using the HTTP protocol over port 80.

MultiSyncMulticast.name: MultiSyncMulticast
MultiSyncMulticast.description: Send MultiSync to ALL remotes via Multicast (239.70.80.80)
MultiSyncMulticast.tip: Send MultiCast to 239.70.80.80 to send MultiSync messages to all remotes.

MultiSyncRefreshStatus.name: MultiSyncRefreshStatus
MultiSyncRefreshStatus.description: Auto refresh status of FPP Systems
MultiSyncRefreshStatus.tip: Auto refresh status of FPP Systems.  The Simple View refreshes every second and Advanced View refreshes every 5 seconds.

ntpServer.name: ntpServer
ntpServer.tip: NTP Server to use to sync time. Debian Pool will be used if not set.

openStartDelay.name: openStartDelay
openStartDelay.tip: An extra delay (in ms) between the Player sending the 'Open' command and actually starting the sequence.  This can be used to allow the remotes to have extra time to open the sequence, process videos, etc...   This requires master and remote to both be running FPP 3.2 or newer.  For complex MP4 files on remotes, a value of around 650-800 is likely needed for the remote video to be loaded and buffers filled prior to first frame being displayed.

pauseBackgroundEffects.name: pauseBackgroundEffects
pauseBackgroundEffects.description: Pause background effects during FSEQ playback
pauseBackgroundEffects.tip: Background effects normally continue to run when a sequence is playing.  This setting instructs FPP to pause all background effects when a sequence is running.  When the sequence stops running, the background effects resume playback.

password.name: password
password.tip: Password to protect the User Interface.

passwordEnable.name: passwordEnable
passwordEnable.tip: Enable password protection on the FPP UI

piRTC.name: piRTC
piRTC.tip: The Real Time Clock (RTC) is a hardware clock used by FPP to track time when the Pi or BeagleBone is powered off.  At boot time, the operating system reads the RTC to set the system time.

PresetControlChannel.name: PresetControlChannel
PresetControlChannel.tip: The Command Preset Control Channel allows FPP Command Presets to be triggered by sequence or incoming network data.  Set to '0' to disable.

remoteIgnoreSync.name: remoteIgnoreSync
remoteIgnoreSync.tip: When enabled, videos/music played on the remote will be started and stopped when the main player sends the start/stop events, but no attempt will be made to keep the media in sync with the player during playback.  The media will run smoother, but may get out of sync with the main player.

remoteOffset.name: remoteOffset
remoteOffset.tip: The Remote Offset value allows adjusting the synchronization of a FPP Remote.  The value is specified in milliseconds.  A positive value moves the remote ahead, a negative value moves the remote back.  Changing this value requires a FPPD restart on the remote.  WARNING - This offset applies to both sequence and media files.  If your media files require different offsets per file then you will need to edit the media files to bring them into sync.

ScheduleSeconds.name: ScheduleSeconds
ScheduleSeconds.tip: Allow scheduling down to the second instead of scheduling on minute boundaries.  Enabling this setting will show the seconds value in the Scheduler UI for the Start and End times on schedule entries.

screensaver.name: screensaver
screensaver.tip: Enable screensaver to blank the Raspberry Pi display after startup.  This is useful when you have a projector attached to the HDMI/composite output and do not want the boot screen text console to display on the projector when no video is playing.

SendVendorSerial.name: SendVendorSerial
SendVendorSerial.description: Send cape serial numbers to vendors
SendVendorSerial.tip: Some capes/hats send an identifying serial number to the vendor each time you load the FPP UI.  The vendor can use this information to personally identify you.

showAllOptions.name: showAllOptions
showAllOptions.tip: If FPPD can detect what hardware (cape/hat/etc...) is connected, certain options that are either incompatible with the hardware or are rarely used may not be displayed.  This setting forces FPP to display to display all options even for hardware that was not detected.

statsPublish.name: statsPublish
statsPublish.tip: Configures if anonymous hardware and feature statistics are shared with the FPP Development team. (FPP must have access to the Internet.) A value of "Banner" will result in a prompt being displayed on the user's screen. Setting this to "Enabled" or "Disabled" removes the banner

tableColorPair1A.name: tableColorPair1A
tableColorPair1A.tip: Color Pair 1-A and 1-B are used for alternating colors in tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair1B.name: tableColorPair1B
tableColorPair1B.tip: Color Pair 1-A and 1-B are used for alternating colors in tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair2A.name: tableColorPair2A
tableColorPair2A.tip: Color Pair 2-A and 2-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair2B.name: tableColorPair2B
tableColorPair2B.tip: Color Pair 2-A and 2-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair3A.name: tableColorPair3A
tableColorPair3A.tip: Color Pair 3-A and 3-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair3B.name: tableColorPair3B
tableColorPair3B.tip: Color Pair 3-A and 3-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair4A.name: tableColorPair4A
tableColorPair4A.tip: Color Pair 4-A and 4-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

tableColorPair4B.name: tableColorPair4B
tableColorPair4B.tip: Color Pair 4-A and 4-B are used for alternating colors in nested tables in the FPP UI

temperatureInF.name: temperatureInF
temperatureInF.tip: Display temperatures in Fahrenheit or Celsius

TetherInterface.name: TetherInterface
TetherInterface.tip: WiFi interface to use for tethering.

TetherPSK.name: TetherPSK
TetherPSK.tip: Pre Shared Key to use to connect to FPP WiFi tethering.

TetherSSID.name: TetherSSID
TetherSSID.tip: SSID to use for FPP WiFi tethering.

TetherTechnology.name: TetherTechnology
TetherTechnology.tip: FPP WiFi tethering technology to use.

TimeFormat.name: TimeFormat
TimeFormat.note: Any addition of a new format in the options array here will need corresponding additions in js/fpp.js to the Convert24H*UIFormat functions

uiLevel.name: uiLevel
uiLevel.tip: The UI Level setting controls the level of settings that are exposed in the UI.  The default 'Basic' level exposes settings which are used by most users.  The 'Advanced' level provides additional settings to control most features within FPP.  'Experimental' is for experts only and exposes settings which may negatively affect system performance or cause issues if incorrectly used.  'Developer' is for developer and beta tester use.

verbosePlaylistItemDetails.name: verbosePlaylistItemDetails
verbosePlaylistItemDetails.tip: Show verbose playlist item details in Playlist Editor and Status UIs

VideoOutput.name: VideoOutput
VideoOutput.tip: The Default Video Output device to be used when playing a video.  On all FPP systems, video played in a playlist can be displayed on a Pixel Overlay model.  On the Raspberry Pi, video can also be played on the HDMI/Composite video outputs.

TimeZone.name: TimeZone
TimeZone.tip: The Time Zone is used to set the local time zone of this FPP instance.
